title: Job Openings at SixthLab Medical
content:
SixthLab Medical (also appearing as Sixth?Lab?Ventures) is a Nigeria-based company specialising in the supply and servicing of diagnostic and therapeutic medical equipment and consumables.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) IT & Social Media Support Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This is a hybrid role with major focus on social media management (70%) and basic IT support (30%).
	You’ll craft content, engage with our online community, generate leads, and also provide first-level tech assistance to our team.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage our social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn) — content creation, posting, engagement
	Generate and track leads from social media; support sales team
	Monitor social media performance & produce regular analytics reports
	Respond to customer inquiries via social channels
	Provide frontline IT support: troubleshoot PCs, printers, internet, and email issues
	Install and maintain basic software; manage digital assets


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, IT, Communications, or related field
	2 – 3 years of experience in social media management + basic IT support
	Strong content creation skills (graphics, copywriting)
	Familiarity with social media analytics tools
	Good problem-solving and customer service attitude
	Basic troubleshooting skills (hardware, software, connectivity).


Why Join Us


	Salary Range: N100,000 – N120,000 (This will be reviewed upwards after the probation period based on Satisfactory performance).
	Work in a niche and growing healthcare-technology company
	Play a key role in growing our online lead generation
	Opportunity to learn both digital marketing and IT in a professional environment
	Collaborative team and supportive management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short portfolio of your social media work (content you’ve created or managed) to: hrsixthlab@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Business Development Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Market Development and Client Acquisition:


	Identify and research potential clients, partners, and new market opportunities.
	Develop and implement strategies to attract and retain clients in both private and public sectors.
	Generate qualified leads and follow up to conversion through consultative selling.
	Conduct product presentations, demonstrations, and negotiations with prospective clients.
	Prepare tailored business proposals, quotations, and tender documents.


Client Relationship and Account Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients.
	Provide after-sales support and ensure client satisfaction and loyalty.
	Serve as a liaison between clients and internal departments to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records and sales documentation.


Strategic Planning and Market Intelligence:


	Conduct regular market research and competitor analysis to identify trends and opportunities.
	Provide feedback to management on market conditions, pricing strategies, and product performance.
	Collaborate with marketing and technical teams to plan promotions, exhibitions, and marketing campaigns.
	Participate in industry events, trade shows, and conferences to represent the company and build networks.


Sales Performance and Reporting:


	Meet and exceed assigned sales and revenue targets.
	Prepare and submit weekly and monthly sales performance reports.
	Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of business development initiatives.
	Provide accurate forecasts and contribute to planning and budgeting processes.


Negotiation and Contract Management:


	Negotiate terms and close sales that align with company objectives and profitability goals.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and ethical business practices in all transactions.
	Follow up on payments and ensure timely receipt of funds in collaboration with the Accounts team.


Qualifications


	Minimum of HND or BSc in Marketing, Business Administration, Science, or related field.
	2–4 years of relevant experience in business development or sales (preferably in a medical/laboratory equipment or healthcare environment).
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.


Salary


	N100,000 - N120,000 per month.
	N60,000 Monthly Float Allowance
	1% Sales commission.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short portfolio of your social media work (content you’ve created or managed) to: hrsixthlab@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Reagent Sales Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Overview


	We are seeking energetic and self-motivated OND holders to join our Reagents Sales & Marketing Team at SixthLab.
	The ideal candidates will drive market penetration by selling our range of medical and laboratory reagents directly to wholesalers, retailers, and end users.
	They will be responsible for generating new leads, achieving sales targets, and ensuring brand visibility at the grassroots level through consistent field marketing activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Actively market and sell SixthLab’s reagents to wholesalers, distributors, and medical outlets.
	Visit assigned territories daily to introduce products, secure new customers, and maintain relationships with existing clients.
	Achieve assigned weekly and monthly sales targets.
	Educate customers on product usage, pricing, and promotional offers.
	Report competitor activities, customer feedback, and market trends.
	Manage and properly utilize the weekly float allowance for field activities.
	Submit accurate daily and weekly sales reports.
	Work with the sales supervisor to plan and execute market activation campaigns.
	Attend product and sales training sessions as required.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	onthly sales volume and revenue generated
	Number of new customers acquired
	Territory coverage and market visibility
	Timeliness and accuracy of sales reports
	Customer satisfaction and retention levels


Qualifications & Skills


	OND in Marketing, Business Administration, Science Laboratory Technology, or related field.
	Prior field sales or marketing experience (especially in pharmaceuticals, reagents, or FMCG) is an advantage.
	Good communication and negotiation skills.
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
	Strong interpersonal skills and a customer-first attitude.
	Must be target-driven and result-oriented.
	Must be willing to travel within assigned territory.


Work Hours:


	Monday – Friday:8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.
	Saturdays:9:00 a.m. – 2:00 p.m


Compensation & Benefits


	Base Salary: N70,000 per month
	Weekly Float Allowance:?7,000 (for field expenses)
	Commission:percentage on reagent sold
	Work Schedule:Monday to Friday, not allSaturdays
	Performance Incentives:Additional rewards based on volume and target achievement


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrsixthlab@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: You can also reach out to this number 09027331373 via WhatsApp.

  "title": "Senior Operations Manager",
  "description": "Control Risks exists to make our clients succeed. We are a specialist risk consultancy that helps to create secure, compliant and resilient organisations in an age of ever-changing risk.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Operations Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Full Time (Hybrid)

About the job


	Control Risks is a specialist risk consultancy that helps to create secure, compliant and resilient organizations in an age of ever-changing risk.
	Working across disciplines, technologies and geographies, everything we do is based on our belief that taking risks is essential to our clients&#39; success.
	We go beyond problem-solving and give our clients the insight and intelligence they need to realise opportunities and grow.
	From the boardroom to the remotest location, we have developed an unparalleled ability to bring order to chaos and reassurance to anxiety.
	To drive the Crisis Security Consulting business with a focus on the delivery of embedded consulting services to our clients.
	The individual will ensure the delivery of commercial, administrative and world class operational support and competence to client projects.
	This is a regional role with a focus on Nigeria and wider West Africa.


Responsibilities


	Management of embedded consulting service operations and associated client requirements across West Africa on a day-to-day basis.
	Oversight and quality assurance of the delivery provided by embedded consultants within the region.
	Delivering high quality work in response to identified needs of existing and new clients. Maintaining and expanding business relationships through collaboration with clients.
	Delivery of a wide range of ad-hoc consultancy tasks in response to client needs across the region.
	Personnel management through the whole life cycle of a consultants time on a task, from recruitment onwards. Ensuring that roles are filled on time with consultants whose background and skills are well aligned with the role.
	Develop strong client relationships, ensuring regular client visits are undertaken and any issues proactively identified.
	Ensure quarterly reports are prepared for each project, highlighting areas of strength along with priorities for development.
	Ensure all embedded consulting projects are being delivered on time and in budget.
	Identify and implement operations management processes.
	Developing successful client relationships.
	Creation and management of sales leads.
	Ensure that embedded consultants are effectively supported by Control Risks. Respond to any welfare concerns arising from the embedded consulting team.
	Commercial management of client engagements, ensuring project costs are captured. In conjunction with Business Operations team, ensuring that project administration and project financial recording is timely, accurate and well presented. Also, management of monthly embedded consulting revenue and cost capture spreadsheet.
	Responsible for the operational management of consultants in accordance with client requirements, Control Risks policies and appropriate international standards.
	Scoping new projects and authoring high quality proposals.
	Responsible for the identification and selection of third-party suppliers and vendors. Leads the vetting and management of third-party providers across the region.


Requirements


	A background in delivery of security consultancy services to the highest standard.
	At least 3 years of experience delivering commercial risk management.
	Deep knowledge of Nigeria and wider regional affairs
	Developed commercial skills in relation to the provision of risk management services in Nigeria / West Africa
	Strong report writing skills.
	Experience in successfully managing client / consultant relationships.
	Highly developed communication skills

Senior Operations Manager Job at Control Risks




        
    

        
        Control Risks exists to make our clients succeed. We are a specialist risk consultancy that helps to create secure, compliant and resilient organisations in an age of ever-changing risk.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Operations Manager

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full Time (Hybrid)

About the job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Control Risks is a specialist risk consultancy that helps to create secure, compliant and resilient organizations in an age of ever-changing risk.
	Working across disciplines, technologies and geographies, everything we do is based on our belief that taking risks is essential to our clients' success.
	We go beyond problem-solving and give our clients the insight and intelligence they need to realise opportunities and grow.
	From the boardroom to the remotest location, we have developed an unparalleled ability to bring order to chaos and reassurance to anxiety.
	To drive the Crisis Security Consulting business with a focus on the delivery of embedded consulting services to our clients.
	The individual will ensure the delivery of commercial, administrative and world class operational support and competence to client projects.
	This is a regional role with a focus on Nigeria and wider West Africa.


Responsibilities


	Management of embedded consulting service operations and associated client requirements across West Africa on a day-to-day basis.
	Oversight and quality assurance of the delivery provided by embedded consultants within the region.
	Delivering high quality work in response to identified needs of existing and new clients. Maintaining and expanding business relationships through collaboration with clients.
	Delivery of a wide range of ad-hoc consultancy tasks in response to client needs across the region.
	Personnel management through the whole life cycle of a consultants time on a task, from recruitment onwards. Ensuring that roles are filled on time with consultants whose background and skills are well aligned with the role.
	Develop strong client relationships, ensuring regular client visits are undertaken and any issues proactively identified.
	Ensure quarterly reports are prepared for each project, highlighting areas of strength along with priorities for development.
	Ensure all embedded consulting projects are being delivered on time and in budget.
	Identify and implement operations management processes.
	Developing successful client relationships.
	Creation and management of sales leads.
	Ensure that embedded consultants are effectively supported by Control Risks. Respond to any welfare concerns arising from the embedded consulting team.
	Commercial management of client engagements, ensuring project costs are captured. In conjunction with Business Operations team, ensuring that project administration and project financial recording is timely, accurate and well presented. Also, management of monthly embedded consulting revenue and cost capture spreadsheet.
	Responsible for the operational management of consultants in accordance with client requirements, Control Risks policies and appropriate international standards.
	Scoping new projects and authoring high quality proposals.
	Responsible for the identification and selection of third-party suppliers and vendors. Leads the vetting and management of third-party providers across the region.


Requirements


	A background in delivery of security consultancy services to the highest standard.
	At least 3 years of experience delivering commercial risk management.
	Deep knowledge of Nigeria and wider regional affairs
	Developed commercial skills in relation to the provision of risk management services in Nigeria / West Africa
	Strong report writing skills.
	Experience in successfully managing client / consultant relationships.
	Highly developed communication skills

  "description": "Wema Bank Plc - Widely reputed as the longest surviving and most resilient indigenous bank in Nigeria, Wema Bank Plc has over the years, diligently offered a fully-fledged range of value-adding banking and financial advisory services to the Nigerian public.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Bancassurance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Bancassurance Officer is responsible for driving insurance sales, deepening customer engagement, and supporting overall revenue growth through the bank&rsquo;s strategic partnership with insurance providers.
	The role involves working closely with branch and insurance partner to promote approved insurance products, ensure seamless service delivery, and achieve assigned performance targets.
	The officer acts as the key liaison between the bank and its insurance partners, ensuring that customer needs are met, compliance is maintained, and the bancassurance channel contributes effectively to the bank&rsquo;s business objectives.


Key Responsibilities / Accountabilities
Sales and Business Development:


	Drive adoption of insurance products (life, health, general, etc.) through Bancassurance staff in bank branches.
	Identify new business opportunities within the bank network and proactively engage to convert them.
	Support bank staff in generating leads, closing sales, and cross-selling insurance products to existing bank customers.
	Achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual sales and premium income targets.
	Conduct periodic sales reviews and develop action plans for improvement in performance.


Relationship Management:


	Maintain a strong working relationship with branch managers, relationship officers, and other key bank personnel.
	Serve as the liaison between the bank and the insurance company to ensure smooth collaboration and issue resolution.


Training and Capacity Building:


	Conduct periodic product knowledge and refresher sessions for branch staff on insurance products and processes.
	Provide guidance to bank staff on identifying customer needs and offering appropriate insurance solutions.
	Collaborate with insurance partners to conduct staff capacity-building sessions and ensure continuous product awareness.


Customer Service and Policy Administration:


	Ensure accurate documentation, underwriting, and policy issuance within agreed timelines.
	Follow up on premium collections, renewals, and customer complaints to ensure timely resolution.
	Liaise with the insurance underwriting and claims departments to ensure smooth processing and feedback to customers.


Reporting and Performance Analysis:


	Prepare weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports on bancassurance performance against set targets
	Provide regular updates on sales activities, challenges, and achievements to the Bancassurance Manager.
	Analyze customer feedback and market trends to identify opportunities for business growth.


Compliance and Risk Management:


	Ensure full compliance with regulatory, company, and partner bank policies.
	Maintain ethical selling practices and protect the reputation of the insurance company and the partner bank.
	Monitor branch-level activities to ensure adherence to agreed service standards and governance requirements.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Achieved assigned insurance premium and revenue targets.
	Customer satisfaction and policy retention rate.
	Timeliness of policy processing and claims resolution.
	Accuracy and quality of sales and performance reports.&nbsp;


Requirements
Qualifications and Experience:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Insurance, Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;7 years of experience in insurance sales, preferably within a bancassurance or partnership distribution setting.
	Certification in insurance (e.g., CIIN, ACII) is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of insurance products, banking operations, and financial services distribution.


Skills and Competencies:


	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong sales and relationship management abilities.
	Analytical and reporting skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
	Good organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
	Customer-centric mindset with a high level of professionalism and integrity.
